data.title: The Best New York Knicks Power Forwards of All Time
data.meta_description: Over 200 sports fans have voted on the 60+ athletes on Best New York Knicks Power Forwards of All Time. Current Top 3: Amar'e Stoudemire, Larry Johnson, ...
data.text:
Ranked By

1.6K votes

296 voters

2 reranks

Voting Rules

Vote up the players who had the most success for the New York Knicks

Latest additions: Precious Achiuwa

Most divisive: Danilo Gallinari

Over 200 Ranker voters have come together to rank this list of The Best New York Knicks Power Forwards of All Time

Big fan of New York basketball? Then check out this list of New York Knicks power forwards. It includes almost every power forward from throughout New York Knicks history, including current power forwards and past ones. Featuring some of the greatest NBA power forwards of all time, the best Knicks PFs include Ken Sears, Dave DeBusschere, and Amar'e Stoudemire.

In the 2021-22 NBA season, the current New York Knicks starting PFs and backup PFs are Julius Randle, Obi Toppin, and Kevin Knox.

Who are the best power forwards in New York Knicks history? Vote below and help decide the greatest Knicks PFs of all time

Birthplace : USA, Florida, Lake Wales

Nationality : United States of America

Team : New York Knicks

Position : Power forward, Center

New York Knicks: 2010–2015

Signed as a free agent in 2010, Amar'e Stoudemire immediately became a driving force behind the resurgent New York Knicks. With his explosive athleticism and scoring prowess, Stoudemire led the team back to relevance and inspired the fan base with his famous "STAT" moniker (an acronym for "Standing Tall and Talented"). During his tenure, Stoudemire would earn an All-NBA Second Team nod in 2011 and help bring playoff basketball back to Madison Square Garden.

Birthplace : Texas, Tyler, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Power forward

New York Knicks: 1996–2001

Arriving via trade in 1996, Larry Johnson brought a new level of scoring and athleticism to the New York Knicks' frontcourt. Known for his strength, quickness, and ability to score both inside and outside, Johnson played an integral part in the Knicks' memorable 1999 NBA Finals run. Who could forget his iconic four-point play against the Indiana Pacers in the Eastern Conference Finals, a moment forever etched in Knicks history?

Birthplace : Miami, Florida

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Small forward, Power forward

New York Knicks: 1991-1996

Acquired in 1991 as a free agent, Anthony Mason's gritty, blue-collar style of play quickly made him a fan favorite and key contributor for the New York Knicks. A versatile power forward, Mason's ability to handle the ball and make plays allowed him to thrive in head coach Pat Riley's system. In 1995, his efforts were rewarded with the NBA Sixth Man of the Year Award, and he would continue to showcase his skills alongside Knicks legends like Patrick Ewing and John Starks.

Birthplace : Detroit, Michigan

Nationality : United States of America

Team : New York Knicks, Detroit Pistons

Position : Power forward

New York Knicks: 1968–1974

Acquired via trade in 1968, Dave DeBusschere solidified the Knicks' frontcourt and played a pivotal role in the franchise's two NBA championships in 1970 and 1973. Known for his tenacious defense and exceptional rebounding, DeBusschere was named to the NBA All-Defensive First Team six times during his time in New York. In addition to his on-court exploits, he also made history as the youngest head coach in NBA history at age 24 when he took on a dual role as player-coach for the Detroit Pistons.

Birthplace : Cleveland, Ohio, USA

Nationality : United States of America

Position : Power forward, Center

New York Knicks: 1988–1998

An imposing presence on the court, Charles Oakley began his tenure with the New York Knicks in 1988 after a trade from the Chicago Bulls. A tenacious rebounder, Oakley's hard-nosed style of play endeared him to fans and teammates alike during his decade-long stint with the team. Known for his defensive prowess, Oakley was named to the NBA All-Defensive First Team in 1994 and played a critical role in the Knicks' run to the NBA Finals that same year.

Birthplace : Dallas, Texas

Nationality : United States of America

Team : New York Knicks

Position : Power forward

New York Knicks: 2019-2022

Joining the New York Knicks as a free agent in 2019, Julius Randle immediately made his presence felt with a dominant scoring and rebounding game. Randle's ability to handle the ball and facilitate for his teammates made him an indispensable offensive weapon. In his second season with the team, Randle was awarded the NBA's Most Improved Player in 2021 and led the Knicks back to the playoffs for the first time since 2013.
